title: Fix - `useIsTruncated` gives incorrect results (rect)
body:
Fixes #45358

### Description

The current [`getIsTruncated`](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/blob/54c1e07/frontend/src/metabase/hooks/use-is-truncated.ts#L41-L46) implementation uses `clientHeight`/`clientWidth`/`scrollHeight`/`scrollWidth`:
- these properties are integers and so they lose precision - it means they don't account for cases where 0px < difference < 1px (where "difference" means the difference between ellipsis being applied and not)
- setting `width` on an element may prevent it from resizing when ellipsis is applied, so comparing the aforementioned properties won't give any useful information

This PR changes the `getIsTruncated` to use floating-point-precise `getBoundingClientRect` instead.

It's a bit awkward to mock `getBoundingClientRect` in unit tests to test ellipsis - we have 3 cases.
I kept it for now, but in the future we should only be testing ellipsis/tooltips in e2e tests.

### How to verify

CI is green.
author: kamilmielnik

title: Cache liquibase migration parsing
body:
### Description

A large chunk of testing time (both "real" and "user") is spent running tests that perform Liquibase migrations. Profiling those tests showed that a significant contributor is Liquibase re-parsing YAML migration files and constructing its in-memory representations of them.

This PR injects a test-only custom caching parser to Liquibase's default parser factory.

The new code can be added anywhere where it is guaranteed to be loaded early. I don't quite like where I've put it so far, so I'll be glad to move it somewhere else if you point me to a suitable location.
author: alexander-yakushev

title: funnel chart handle duplicated steps
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/45296

### Description

Handles duplicated funnel steps by summing their values.

### How to verify

```sql
select 'foo' x, 100 y
union all select 'foo', 90
union all select 'bar', 80
union all select 'baz', 70
union all select 'baz', 10
```

- create a funnel chart from the query above
- ensure the funnel chart does not show duplicated steps and instead sums their values

### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: SCIM FE
body:
Closes #43132

### Description

Implementation for the FE for SCIM following the designs shown here: [figma](https://www.figma.com/design/E42ezp6P3kY4PJj0r5tIOM/Support-SCIM-for-user-provisioning-and-deprovisioning?node-id=2095-1152)

### How to verify

- go to admin settings -> authentication
-  click on the new "user provisioning" tab
- enable scim for the first time
- try disabling scim + enabling again
- try regenerating a token
- try enabling SAML SSO to engage different parts of the experience
- test out on both OSS and EE

title: Add default value to report_card.last_used_at
body:
This PR:
1. Makes `report_card.last_used_at` non-null
2. Sets the default value to the current timestamp.

There are two motivations behind this change.

1. `report_card.last_used_at` is a nullable column that currently is not being used. In most cases the value will be non-null, but in some rare cases, such as when the card is serialized or from the app-db, it will be null. I suspect that can easily lead to bugs when we eventually do use the column. This PR prevents that bug from happening.
2. `last_used_at` will be used to identify stale questions that can be cleaned up automatically. If a card is imported from another instance, we don't want it to be immediately cleaned up. And neither do we want to never clean it up if it is never "used". It makes sense to consider it "last used" from the time it was imported for this use case.

More context [here](https://metaboat.slack.com/archives/C0641E4PB9B/p1720549646851889).

Related: https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/44240
author: calherries
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/Workflows', 'aka BEC')]

title: fix: Reduce bcrypt work factor when running tests
body:
### Description

Preliminary analysis showed that this redundant work is responsible for ~15% of driver test runtime (and possibly other testing time as well). @camsaul has suggested this trivial approach to address this. We reduce the work factor to 4 which is the minimal that the underlying BCrypt library accepts. In terms of the time to hash a single password the difference is the following:

| Factor | Time to hash 1 password |
|---|---|
| 10 | 75 ms |
| 4 | 1.5 ms |

Thus, decreasing the factor in tests to 4 should remove its impact on test times almost completely.

Not sure if any tests are necessary here?
author: alexander-yakushev
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch')]

title: Fixes the formatting
body:
Fixes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/45298

Before
====

```
2024-07-04 15:54:39,084 INFO metabase.server :: Shutting Down Embedded Jetty Webserver
Exception in thread "Thread-9" java.util.IllegalFormatConversionException: f != java.lang.Long
2024-07-04 15:54:39,122 WARN db.liquibase :: (#object[liquibase.Liquibase 0x2b7e6614 liquibase.Liquibase@2b7e6614])
	at java.base/java.util.Formatter$FormatSpecifier.failConversion(Unknown Source)
	at java.base/java.util.Formatter$FormatSpecifier.printFloat(Unknown Source)
	at java.base/java.util.Formatter$FormatSpecifier.print(Unknown Source)
	at java.base/java.util.Formatter.format(Unknown Source)
	at java.base/java.util.Formatter.format(Unknown Source)
	at java.base/java.lang.String.format(Unknown Source)
	at clojure.core$format.invokeStatic(core.clj:5770)
	at clojure.core$format.doInvoke(core.clj:5764)
	at clojure.lang.RestFn.invoke(RestFn.java:423)
	at metabase.db.liquibase$wait_for_all_locks.invokeStatic(liquibase.clj:258)
	at metabase.db.liquibase$wait_for_all_locks.invoke(liquibase.clj:251)
	at metabase.db.setup$release_migration_locks_BANG_.invokeStatic(setup.clj:175)
	at metabase.db.setup$release_migration_locks_BANG_.invoke(setup.clj:170)
	at metabase.db$release_migration_locks_BANG_.invokeStatic(db.clj:91)
	at metabase.db$release_migration_locks_BANG_.invoke(db.clj:86)
	at metabase.core$destroy_BANG_.invokeStatic(core.clj:90)
	at metabase.core$destroy_BANG_.invoke(core.clj:81)
	at clojure.lang.AFn.run(AFn.java:22)
	at java.base/java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)
```

And now it will correctly log

```
2024-07-09 16:04:28,345 INFO db.liquibase :: Waiting for migration lock(s) to be released (max 0.4 secs)
```

Why no tests?
====

There _is_ a test that would have caught this. And in fact running at the repl will catch it:

```clojure
liquibase=> (do (require 'clojure.test 'metabase.db.liquibase-test)
                (clojure.test/run-test metabase.db.liquibase-test/wait-for-all-locks-test))

Testing metabase.db.liquibase-test

ERROR in (wait-for-all-locks-test) (Formatter.java:4515)

:h2
 Will timeout if a lock is not released
expected: (= :timed-out (liquibase/wait-for-all-locks sleep-ms timeout-ms))
  actual: java.util.IllegalFormatConversionException: f != clojure.lang.Ratio
```

(note that ratios are exact so sometimes they become longs which is what you see in the original error message. Eg: `[(type (/ 3 2)) (type (/ 4 2))]` is `[clojure.lang.Ratio java.lang.Long]`) 

But this _passes_ in CI:

```
‚ùØ clj -X:dev:test :only metabase.db.liquibase-test/wait-for-all-locks-test
Finding tests took 23.5 s.
Running 1 tests
Running before-run hooks...

Ran 1 tests in 1.461 seconds
3 assertions, 0 failures, 0 errors.
{:test 1, :pass 3, :fail 0, :error 0, :type :summary, :duration 1461.175042, :single-threaded 1}
Ran 0 tests in parallel, 1 single-threaded.
Finding and running tests took 25.0 s.
All tests passed.
Running after-run hooks...
```

And that's because the log level in testing is FATAL and this is an INFO level log.

Discussed ways to improve this like adding a null logger during CI but we aren't ready to increase CI times for that just yet.
author: dpsutton
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge')]

title: fix: Reduce bcrypt work factor when running tests
body:
### Description

Preliminary analysis showed that this redundant work is responsible for ~15% of driver test runtime (and possibly other testing time as well). @camsaul has suggested this trivial approach to address this. We reduce the work factor to 4 which is the minimal that the underlying BCrypt library accepts. In terms of the time to hash a single password the difference is the following:

| Factor | Time to hash 1 password |
|---|---|
| 10 | 75 ms |
| 4 | 1.5 ms |

Thus, decreasing the factor in tests to 4 should remove its impact on test times almost completely.

Not sure if any tests are necessary here?
author: alexander-yakushev

title: Reduce parameter churn when loading a synced parameter list
body: When loading a saved question that has parameters with default values, the initial page load causes search parameters to be added to the url. Subsequent edits to the parameters also update the search parameters. The way this was set up using `useEffect` was causing a lot of back and forth between adding an removing the parameters. On every render of the component the search parameters were first removed and then added again. This causes the url bar to flicker. This change decouples the updating of the search parameters from the removing of search parameters on unmount, causing significantly less calls to the `history.replaceState`. All functionality should remain the same and tests are already in place. ### Before ### After ## To test this 1. Create a native query with a parameter 2. Add a default value to the parameter 3. Navigate to the question and keep an eye on the url, it should no longer flicker

title: Make import work on a fresh install
body:
This introduces a new metadata on commands, `:requires-init`. If set, we'll run `metabase.core/init!` before running the command. `init!` will initialize the database and run our normal startup, though it won't actually start the Metabase server.

This allows you to use

```
env MB_CONFIG_FILE_PATH=... java -jar metabase.jar import /my/metabase/export
```

We'll run the normal init process (creating the internal user, loading from the config file, etc), then run the command.

On my machine this adds about 2-3 seconds to the time it takes to run an `import`.
author: johnswanson

title: [serdes] allow entity ids in targets
body:
Fixes #45224

We're not accepting anything than Collection from outside (both CLI and API are explicitly only asking for collection ids), but it feels too fragile not to support this a bit more universally. It's not absolutely universal (see comment for `eid->id`), but I think that's good enough for now.

title: restrict open redirects imitating no host in them
body:
This fixes case like `redirect_to=https:///google.com`, which URI thinks has no host, but browsers have no problem just dropping one slash like it's no big deal.

There is one thing about current logic which bothers me a little bit: we're appending host if url is not relative and then check if it's conforming. Maybe it should work the other way: just append the host and that's it? This way we need to check that urls we generate for `sso-get` are always relative, but I'm pretty sure that it should be this way.

I guess I could be missing a part of logic somewhere, but it feels like checking if something is broken is way too prone for errors, it's better to just shut the door completely.
author: piranha
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/Workflows', 'aka BEC')]

body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/44869

Passes the missing size prop to the info icon which was causing a single pixel shift.

### How to verify


1. New sql question
2. Type `select * from orders where tax = {{t}}`
3. Change variable type to the field filter
4. Move mouse over the list of available fields

title: Use single connection for test data loading & big test data loading improvements
body:
Resolves #45378
Fixes #45760

- Reuse one connection for test data loading instead of one connection per statement or chunk of rows to load (extremely wasteful). Big CI performance improvement.
- Do not destroy and recreate test datasets several dozen times during test runs.
- Fix a bunch of tests that weren't cleaning up after themselves that previously used to work ok because we destroyed and recreated test data so many times -- especially CSV upload tests, which created dozens of orphaned `UPLOADED_MAGIC_EXAMPLE_` tables.
- Do not destroy existing test datasets with the same name automatically when loading test data. No longer needed since we're smart enough to only load data if needed now
- Added `metabase.test.data.interface/dataset-already-loaded?` to check if given test data is already loaded; if it is, test data loading code will reuse it rather than destroying and recreating it. 
- **BIG! Test data loading code now automatically checks whether test Databases created in previous sessions have test data loaded or not and automatically reloads data in place (reusing existing Database) if needed**
- Test Databases now include driver name in their `:name` e.g. `test-data (postgres)` for ease of use from the GUI
- Overhaul the confusing JDBC test data loading methods. See driver changelog for more info. This is hopefully a stepping stone to more significant overhauls in the near future, specifically #45079
- Increased test data chunk size for Spark SQL from 200 to 1000, which means **test data loading for Spark SQL is now ~5x faster**, e.g. 11 seconds to load the `orders` table instead of 60
- Presto JDBC test data loading is at least 2x faster
author: camsaul
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch')]

body:
Fixes: #44962

Prior, a common util fn used both in the embed and preview_embed endpoints was causing the preview_embed to error out
when fetching dashboard parameter values because it was checking if embedding was enabled. This check is needed for
the normal embedding endpoints, but we want the preview embed endpoints to work without needing to publish the
dashboard first.

title: Fix funnel chart settings crash on null
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/45255

### Description

When funnel chart dataset dimension values included null the viz settings sidebar crashed due to DnD library not being able to handle `null` keys.

The static funnel chart also does not work correctly on null dimension values but after spending some time I could not figure out the BE piece of it quick enough so I extracted it here: https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/45261

### How to verify

```sql
select 'foo' step, 10 v
union all select 'baz', 8
union all select null, 6
union all select 'bar', 4
```

1. Create a funnel chart using the query above
2. Ensure you can view and edit viz settings

### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: Async coll perm graph revision
body:
Pursuant to https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/39997

Improves collection graph update performance, especially on problematic instances that have 1000+ collections and perm groups, by making the costly process of writing the potentially gigantic revision json blob to the db into an async process.

An alternative solution is to remove the collection perm graph revision capturing entirely. We still might do that since metabase/metabase does not use the perm graph revision for anything. But it may be nice to have for users and/or support. If it's needed, we could consider a diff-based approach instead.
author: escherize

The main problem with core.async is that the core.async threadpool is only 4 threads so if you exhaust those threads doing processing you basically brick core.async across the app. It's also kinda easy to leak channels that don't get closed and hard to debug compared to regular threadpools

title: [perf] Fix remaining thread leak in BigQuery query execution
body:
This comes in two parts.

**Rebuilt query logic**

I rewrote the query exec logic to use two `core.async` channels
and one `future`, instead of two `future`s. This is better supported and
not prone to leaking one or the other future when exceptions are thrown
at bad times, or `cancel-chan` isn't closed properly.

The single future is guaranteed to exit. It blocks on the BigQuery call.
That will either complete or throw an exception. Either the exception or
the BigQuery result is pushed to the channel, then the future is
complete. The put to the channel never blocks, because it's a freshly
created `promise-chan` that instantly accepts the first put, and drops
any later ones.

**Return a reducible result**

Previously the results were returned as a lazy sequence, but that brings
a lot of `seq` overhead, and is a risk of retaining the entire result
set in memory until the query is all done. Above all, it doesn't support
`reduced?` to explicitly drop any further results.

The `thunk` function style of `qp.reducible/reducible-rows` doesn't fit
neatly here, so I implemented the reducible logic directly on top of the
`Iterable` BigQuery result.

**Verifying**

This is a bit tricky. I've been testing it like this:

- Add a BigQuery database to my instance
- Create a saved question and note its ID (say, 123)
- Create an API key in (EE) Metabase and save it in an env var
- Install the `siege` load testing tool
- Install VisualVM and monitor my Clojure REPL process's thread count
- `siege --concurrent=15 --time=30s --header="x-api-key: $API_KEY" "http://localhost:3000/api/card/123/query POST"`

That will create a bunch of new threads while it's getting called, but
within a minute of the last queries they'll gradually drop out of the
thread pools and it will return to the baseline number of threads.
author: bshepherdson
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge')]

title: Only drop idx_uniq_field_table_id_parent_id_name if it exists
body:
Follows up https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/44866

As part of https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/44866, we drop the unique constraint `idx_uniq_field_table_id_parent_id_name`. The problem is, there could be Metabase instances where this constraint has been dropped manually for whatever reason. We don't want to block upgrades just because someone has dropped the constraint from their app DB.

This PR adds a pre-condition to the changeset that drops the constraint where we will skip it if the constraint has already been dropped.

Bugs producing false negatives in the precondition (i.e. thinking the constraint doesn't exist when it actually does) would have been caught by all existing automated tests that downgrade. There's no automated test coverage for false positives (thinking the constraint does exist when it actually doesn't). I have tested it this manually on MySQL, H2, and Postgres. I'm not sure writing a test for that is worth it given it's much harder to write a bug producing false positives that is not super obvious.

This needs to be backported to 49.
author: calherries
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/Workflows', 'aka BEC')]

title: Sync `table.columns` and `graph.metrics` viz settings based on the desired column alias
body:
Follow up for https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/45180

Changes:
- Makes viz setting sync work for query updates. This was previously not possible because we relied on the field ref; and field refs are different between QP and MBQL lib. Now we don't use field refs for these settings, and we can finally make the settings in sync with MBQL queries using MBQL lib without running the query.
- Rely on `:lib/desired-column-alias` to identify `column.name` changes between queries. `column.name` used in the settings can change, but `:lib/desired-column-alias` is a more stable ID. Unfortunately throwing away `column.name` and using the alias is a huge breaking change that would affect BE API, serialization etc, so using the alias during the update but not actually saving it is a much safer and easier to implement option.
- Unifies syncing between different settings.

How to verify (there is an existing e2e test for this):
- New -> Question -> Orders. In the field selector select only "ID".
- Join -> Products. Select "ID" only.
- Join -> People. Select "ID" only.
- Visualize
- Open the viz settings sidebar and hide "Products.ID"
- Now click "Add or remove columns" and uncheck "Products.ID"
- After update you should see "Orders.ID" and "People.ID" as expected, despite all columns having "ID" name.

What's next?
- We still have `column_settings` that rely on field refs, but we would follow the same approach there - no breaking API changes, use the alias during the sync.

title: Add dialect based feature flags for macaw
body:
Refs https://github.com/metabase/macaw/issues/42

Macaw is [about to](https://github.com/metabase/macaw/pull/78) support the various [parser features](https://jsqlparser.github.io/JSqlParser/usage.html#define-the-parser-features) exposed by the underlying JSQLParser library. 

This PR wires them up in a vaguely plausible way for now - at least enough to close https://github.com/metabase/macaw/issues/42.

Looking forward we're either wanting to replace this big map with (a) multimethod(s), or give Macaw its own hierarchy and just pass down the driver. Or the first ancestor of the driver that Macaw knows about...

title: ci(admin/performance): Test several caching strategies and methods
body:
This PR tests that the user can assign any of three cache invalidation strategies ("duration", "adaptive", and "don't cache") to dashboards and questions. The tests check that the following things are true:
* These strategies can be applied directly (via the sidebar)
* Dashboards and questions can inherit their caching strategy from the database that underlies them
* Dashboards and questions can inherit their caching strategy from the instance-wide default policy
* When a question inside a dashboard has been assigned a strategy, this is overridden by the strategy assigned to the dashboard.

What these tests do not examine:
* caching on OSS
* the schedule strategy
* the minimum query duration
* edge-case strategies, such as very long durations or very large values for the adaptive strategy multiplier

These may be addressed in follow-up work.

Closes #45355

title: Do not show revert button for default parameter
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/38083

### Description

Fixes an issue where the default value and values were being compared incorrectly (as direct values and arrays).

This PR coerces all of them to arrays so the comparisons are correct.


### How to verify

Describe the steps to verify that the changes are working as expected.

1. Create a native question `select * from people where state = {{ state }}`,
2. Make it required and add a default value, say `CA`,
3. Save the question and reload the page with `?state=CA` in the URL,
4. Observe that the parameter widget does not have a reset icon,
5. For other values in the URL `state=OR` should still show the icon.


### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR
author: romeovs
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/Querying', '')]

title: Support backward compatibility when passing `theme=transparent`
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/45202

### Description

Support backward compatibility by allowing `theme=transparent`. There's no CSS change since everything is already working fine. This PR ensures we override `theme=transparent` and `background=false` to `theme: "light"` and `background: false` [(spec)](https://www.notion.so/metabase/Re-design-transparent-theme-for-static-embedding-and-public-links-a28e98a6e5c64301a48387c7b333d569?pvs=4#2e1eff4f88df49e3b6ee7e37af559ea1).

### How to verify

Try applying `theme=transparent&background=false` to static embedding dashboards ([questions don't have `background` option](https://www.notion.so/metabase/Re-design-transparent-theme-for-static-embedding-and-public-links-a28e98a6e5c64301a48387c7b333d569?pvs=4#2bb0cb2ade334707a0448de8500cc75a)), the beavhior should be like `theme=light&background=false` otherwise, the behavior should be the same as the passed parameters.

### Demo

#### `theme=transparent`
![image](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/1937582/52f226e7-807b-4f1a-a716-f13a9e233602)

#### `theme=transparent&background=false`
![image](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/1937582/d8bbbace-e8a3-45ce-9018-c6ac7d242f29)

#### `theme=light&background=false` should behave the same as the above condition
![image](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/1937582/9c2b9680-e02d-4087-98f4-fdeb3cf57efb)

#### `theme=night&background=false`
![image](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/1937582/0663e3b2-2178-478e-b705-9384e57b90bf)


#### `theme=night`
![image](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/1937582/4f6147ed-9ef8-4eab-a284-42f583ef5e17)


### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR
author: WiNloSt
labels: [('.Team/Embedding', '')]

title: perf: pass uuid to BE to enable metadata caching during fetching dashboard
body: ### Description FE part of https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/45050 we need to pass a UUID to the BE, so it will enable caching and share this cache between calls to `/dahsboard/:dashId` and `/query_metadata`. Additionally we pass another UUID (I don't see a way to share it atm), to share cache between different http calls on `/query` ### How to verify - open a dashboard with cards - check network tab - make sure that parameter `dashboard_load_id` is attached to the http query ### Demo ### Checklist - [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: [serdes] use spec instead of a pipeline for Card
body:
Idea is to add serialization spec to every serializable model, making it more declarative. This will allow us to work with given data and even check various constraints (foreign keys?).

This is a first na√Øve version, but I'm sure it won't be too hard to support all weird corner cases, i.e. inlined models (like tabs and dashcards in Dashboard). I'd rather keep first commit small and understandable to gather some opinions on general approach.

Why three top-level keys instead of just specifying every field as a top-level key: for brevity. It's hard to see what's going on when a model is big as Card.
author: piranha
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/Workflows', 'aka BEC')]

title: [notification] Channel APIs
body:
Epic: https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/43822

This PR adds the `channel` table and 5 apis:
- GET /api/channel : channels listing
- GET /api/channel/:id : get a single channel
- PUT /api/channel/:id : update channel
- POST /api/channel : create a channel
- POST /api/channel/test : test channel connection

Tech doc: https://www.notion.so/metabase/Webhook-for-Alert-4f9c7727e06c4c958687c25e1eece21e?pvs=4

title: Replace duplicate fields in cards
body:
Pursuant towards #44659
Follows https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/45151
author: calherries
labels: [('.Team/Workflows', 'aka BEC')]
comments_list:
[{'comment_id': 2211601529, 'issue_id': 2393350327, 'author': 'replay-io[bot]', 'body': '

Status Complete ‚ÜóÔ∏é
Commit bdee44c0ae5a83c330b1fd1887dd6849e98b3d40
Results
‚ö†Ô∏è 2 Flaky
‚úÖ 2650 Passed
', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 7, 6, 2, 50, 49, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 2215569045, 'issue_id': 2393350327, 'author': 'calherries', 'body': "I recommend giving up on this effort for now. It's hard and risky, and we don't have a lot of evidence these defective fields will be frequently used. Also users can solve the problem manually if they need to, by replacing inactive fields with the actual ones. I thought I could cover most cases with regex replacements. I planned to replace all references that matched the defective field, unless both the defective field and the actual field were used in the same question. But there's an edge case I hadn't considered. Consider this scenario: - Field 1 is the defective duplicate of Field 2 - Question A selects Field 1 - Question B selects Field 2 - Question C selects Field 1 from Question A, and Field 2 from Question B Following my original plan, Question C would break. Question A's reference to Field 1 would be replaced with a reference to Field 2. Question C's reference to Field 1 wouldn't be replaced, because we don't replace any references if both the defective field and the actual field were used in the same question. There are workarounds, but they all involve further complicating the migration. It is already quite risky, and pursuing it risks breaking more questions beyond a level of confidence I'm comfortable with.", 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 7, 8, 23, 54, 2, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}]
comment_thread:
replay-io[bot] on (2024-07-06 02:50:49 UTC):

Status Complete ‚ÜóÔ∏é
Commit bdee44c0ae5a83c330b1fd1887dd6849e98b3d40
Results
‚ö†Ô∏è 2 Flaky
‚úÖ 2650 Passed
calherries (Issue Creator) on (2024-07-08 23:54:02 UTC): I recommend giving up on this effort for now. It's hard and risky, and we don't have a lot of evidence these defective fields will be frequently used. Also users can solve the problem manually if they need to, by replacing inactive fields with the actual ones. I thought I could cover most cases with regex replacements. I planned to replace all references that matched the defective field, unless both the defective field and the actual field were used in the same question. But there's an edge case I hadn't considered. Consider this scenario: - Field 1 is the defective duplicate of Field 2 - Question A selects Field 1 - Question B selects Field 2 - Question C selects Field 1 from Question A, and Field 2 from Question B Following my original plan, Question C would break. Question A's reference to Field 1 would be replaced with a reference to Field 2. Question C's reference to Field 1 wouldn't be replaced, because we don't replace any references if both the defective field and the actual field were used in the same question. There are workarounds, but they all involve further complicating the migration. It is already quite risky, and pursuing it risks breaking more questions beyond a level of confidence I'm comfortable with.

title: fix stacking settings on line charts
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/45182

### Description

Line/bar/area/combo charts are the same given the ability to change individual series display types. However, the stacking settings worked incorrectly when the viz type was `line` by not allowing to change it to something else even when there are stackable series.

### How to verify

- Create multiseries line chart
- Change invidivual series display types to `bar` for at least two series
- Ensure you can change stacking settings

### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR
author: alxnddr
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/DashViz', 'Dashboard and Viz team')]

Here are all the supported types that will be shown in the changelog:
- `feat`
- `fix`
- `perf`

These types `docs`, `style`, `refactor`, `test`, `build`, and `ci` are also encouraged for non-changelog related tasks.

Please also make sure to include `sdk` scope, otherwise, the changelog will not include this task.

title: [WIP] Migrate viz settings key to name-based format
body:
Currently we have 2 formats for viz setting keys:
1. field ref-based: `["ref", ["field", 1, null]]`
2. name-based `["name", "ID"]`

In simple cases (i.e. fields coming from raw tables) we use field refs, in other cases - column names. 

The problem is that field refs can change unpredictably from id-based (`["field", 1, null]`) to name-based  (`["field", "ID", null]`), causing loss of all viz settings. One example where this can happen is when a new query stage is added. 

Another problem is that current field ref-based references prevent us from having multiple identical columns with different `temporal-unit`. `temporal-unit` is omitted from field ref-based keys and that's why such columns would be identical. Names, however, are always unique.

Starting from this PR, the FE will always send name-based keys. For backward compatibility we migrate column keys when processing data from the BE. The migration is done on the FE to reuse the existing `getColumnKey` function to be 100% accurate.

This PR also updates the BE to make sure it always tries to find a setting by a column name. The change should be backward compatible.
author: ranquild
labels: [('do not merge', ''), ('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/Querying', '')]

title: Remove field ref matching from `table.columns`
body:
Fixes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/39993
Fixes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/42049
Fixes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/42203
Fixes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/25885
Fixes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/33959
Fixes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/36364

Currently we have 2 formats for viz setting keys:

- field ref-based: `["ref", ["field", 1, null]]`
- name-based `["name", "ID"]`

In simple cases (i.e. fields coming from raw tables) we use field refs, in other cases - column names.

The problem is that field refs can change unpredictably from id-based (`["field", 1, null]`) to name-based (`["field", "ID", null]`), causing loss of all viz settings. One example where this can happen is when a new query stage is added. Names, however, are always unique. Why use field refs then? With name-based fields refs there are no benefits compared to name-based keys. However, id-based field refs can "survive" certain query updates. One common example is adding multiple implicitly joinable fields with the same name, e.g. for `Orders` add `Products.ID`, hide it, and then add `Users.ID`. `Products.ID` can change from `ID` to `ID_2` during this update, while the id of the column doesn't change. To keep best parts of both worlds, this PR uses column names for everything, but extends the viz setting sync process and handles `column.name` updates for columns with integer ids. This way there are no regressions and issues with field ref changes are fixed.
author: ranquild
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/Querying', '')]

title: [dev tool] monitor all toucan2 queries
body:
demo

https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/25661381/bcb5f55a-d125-438e-a563-2880b6e13731


```clojure
(start!) ;; start tracking

;; do some query using toucan 2 or via UI

;; get all queries and its execution time
(queries) 
;; => [[[\"SELECT * FROM report_card\"] 100]]

;; stop tracking
(stop!)

;; dump all queries to a csv
(to-csv!)

```

title: Do not collide "no results" with "running the query"
body:
### What does this PR accomplish?
Fixes #41464

This logic might change once we start using RTK Query, but for now checking for `isRunning` seemed like the best alternative to `isFetching`.

### Demo
![Kapture 2024-07-05 at 09 02 23](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/31325167/158935a4-6585-434d-8000-aeb97b28df8c)

### Tests
This PR adds E2E reproduction for this issue. I tested it on `master` to make sure it doesn't give me false positives and it was failing there every single time. It should pass without exception on this branch.

![image](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/31325167/e895f4b7-7757-4533-829a-14f398b42674)

To confirm this, here's the stress-test run:

title: [WIP] Use desired column alias for `table.columns`
body:
Cherry-picks https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/43790
Fixes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/42049
Fixes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/39993

I realised that I simply cannot fix the metadata editor until I fix `table.columns`, so here we go. 

Uses new `desired_column_alias` for `table.columns` viz setting. When query results become available, matches the columns with the settings in the old way and assigns `desired_column_alias` to the settings. When `desired_column_alias` is available in `table.columns`, uses it for matching instead.

The change should be backward compatible because we keep setting the old properties (`name`, `fieldRef`). The computed `key` property was dropped. It was derived from `name` and `fieldRef`, so there is no loss of data. Previously the FE back-filled the `key` when needed, so it's not a breaking change. `key` wasn't used on the BE.

Tests TBD.
author: ranquild
labels: [('do not merge', ''), ('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/Querying', '')]

Downloads, subscriptions, and subscription attachments don't necessarily respect the viz-settings applied to a Dashboard Card.

This PR adds an info-level log message to better diagnose OOM issues during JSON unfolding.

Similar to https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/41365, but for JSON unfolding.

After this merges, you'll need to add the logger in the log4j file:

```
<Logger name="metabase.driver.sql-jdbc.sync.describe-table" level="INFO"/>
```

title: Skip fingerprinting or scanning field values for fields with base-type=type/Collection
body:
Pursuant towards fixing https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/44983

This PR skips fingerprinting or scanning field values for fields with `base-type=type/Collection`.

Since https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/13288 we have tried to avoid fingerprinting for any type of blob that can contain large values, such as any type derived from `type/Structured`.

We should extend this to any types which derive from `type/Collection`, like `type/Array` and `type/Dictionary`. There's no value in fingerprinting such values because all we calculate is the distinct-count, which is rather useless.

Previous times we've skipped fingerprinting certain types:
- https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/13325
- https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/29222
- https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/43483

title: Soft-delete defective duplicate fields
body:
Pursuant towards https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/44659
Follows https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/44866 which populates `metabase_field`.`is_defective_duplicate`

Implements step 3 in [this comment](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/44659#issuecomment-2192932023):

> 3. Create a migration to deactivate [defective duplicate] fields. After this point, users can not use defective fields in new questions.

This PR soft-deletes (by setting `active=false`) the subset of defective duplicate fields whose usage can be fully replaced by other fields without affecting the result of any query. It does not attempt to automatically remove these fields.

**To verify:**

1. Start from¬†[[sync] parse naked json values¬†#43812](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/43812)¬†with¬†`git checkout 33df115`
2. Create a database with a few tables, JSON column and at least one other column. (The reason why I created multiple tables is because there is undeterministic behaviour in which the defective field can be synced either before or after the actual field. Depending on the order, the base type of the fields will be either `:type/JSON` or `:type/Array`.)
```sql
CREATE TABLE table_1 (id serial PRIMARY KEY, data jsonb);
INSERT INTO table_1 (data) VALUES ('[1, 2, 3]'::jsonb);
```
3. Create a question that selects only the Data column, and not ID column.
4. Switch to this branch `git switch soft-delete-is-defective-duplicate-fields` and restart Metabase.
5. Visit the question in step 3 and observe the question works as before and can be repaired manually.
author: calherries
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/Workflows', 'aka BEC')]

title: REST API endpoint for Query Validator Tool
body:
[Fixes #45026]

Adds an EE endpoint that exposes cards whose query has problems. Future work will expand the types of bad field refs surfaced, but for now I wanted to get the basic API shape ironed out.

## Acceptance Criteria
The REST API endpoint:

1. Only works with the new EE feature turned on
2. Lets you sort by all the columns in the Figma (edited at, author name, etc.) with the exception of the actual error message, which is still being negotiated with Product
3. Supports the standard pagination params
4. Only shows cards that have a problem.
author: tsmacdonald

title: Avoid native editor autocomplete suggestions flicker
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/34596
Reduces the cases where https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/48712 is relevant

### Description

ACE editor is bit weird: it only updates the autocompletion results when the callback is called. This causes some flicker when the autocompletion API is bit slow (as the linked issue describes).

This PR solves that by splitting the completion into two phases:
1. just takes the existing completions and filters out items that do not match the current prefix. Trigger the autocompletion again (but tell it to go into phase 2).
2. Call the actual autocomplete and talk to the API

This two-phase approach was necessary because we want to update suggestions instantly when typing to remove stale suggestions, but still want to be able to debounce the actual API requests.

### How to verify

Describe the steps to verify that the changes are working as expected.

1. New question -> SQL query
2. Type `PE`, wait for the completions to settle
4. Type `O`, the non-matching completions should dissapear instantly


### Demo

https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/1250185/7eac6265-411e-4dec-b6ae-709305367ef3
author: romeovs
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/Querying', '')]
comments_list:
[{'comment_id': 2209234946, 'issue_id': 2391086827, 'author': 'replay-io[bot]', 'body': '

Status Complete ‚ÜóÔ∏é
Commit 3410770b4732e288fb0a1ff0fd039d2ba81f2963
Results
‚ùå 4 Failed
‚ö†Ô∏è 3 Flaky
‚úÖ 2743 Passed
', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 7, 4, 15, 30, 2, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 2210845503, 'issue_id': 2391086827, 'author': 'romeovs', 'body': 'Closing due to [comment](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/45136#pullrequestreview-2159479955).', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 7, 5, 13, 5, 31, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 2443173277, 'issue_id': 2391086827, 'author': 'romeovs', 'body': "This PR seems to also resolve https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/48712. @ranquild: maybe we could reconsider whether or not the changes are too complex, since it solves two issues? I've rebased and reopened this PR. I personally don't think these changes are more complex then what the current code does, especially if the changes fix two bugs. Alternatively I think we should move away from ACE, but doing that will be more work.", 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 10, 29, 4, 22, 19, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 2444754640, 'issue_id': 2391086827, 'author': 'ranquild', 'body': "@romeovs I'm fine with merging a fix like this but I can't verify if it solves the issue. E.g. here https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/34596 the new behavior matches exactly the old one when locally it flickers once. Also recorded a loom with this https://www.loom.com/share/8cd58775001347249a1039814984980e. Could you explain/record when the new implementation works better than the old one? Could we not update suggestions at all until we receive results from the API?", 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 10, 29, 16, 18, 50, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 2445602231, 'issue_id': 2391086827, 'author': 'romeovs', 'body': '@ranquild What this fixes is not the fact that some completions come in faster than others (due to some of the completions being sync vs some of them being async). This PR makes sure that unrelated results from previous async completions do not linger while we're waiting for the new results. ### Before This is how things worked before this PR 1. We type `PE` - this triggers a call to `/autocomplete_suggestions?substring=PE` - at the same time it triggers the editor to show "sync" completions which come from the SQL grammar (like `type`, etc), they are displayed immediately, the results look like this: ``` type escape update tablesample ``` 2. After a while the results from the call to `/autocomplete_suggestions`, they now get mixed in with the sync results: ``` PEOPLE EXPECTED_INVOICE type escape RATING_MAPPED update tablesample ``` 3. We type `O` (so the text in the editor is `PEO`) - An async call to `/autocomplete_suggestions?substring=PEO` gets made - Immediately, the current suggestions are filtered by the new search text (`PEO`), this also includes results from the previous async call. This includes `EXPECTED_INVOICE` ``` PEOPLE EXPECTED_INVOICE ``` 4. After a while the async results for the second call come in and replace the async results from the first call, they do not include `EXPECTED_INVOICE` so the results now correctly show ``` PEOPLE ``` This means there is a _flicker_ between step 3. and 4. where some results are shown and then dissappear (without the user doing anything). ##### Video https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/81665175-2cc1-41c3-a7ae-fb69051c1151 ### After 1. We type `PE` - this triggers a call to `/autocomplete_suggestions?substring=PE` - at the same time it triggers the editor to show "sync" completions which come from the SQL grammar (like `type`, etc), they are displayed immediately, the results look like this: ``` type escape update tablesample ``` 2. After a while the results from the call to `/autocomplete_suggestions`, they now get mixed in with the sync results: ``` PEOPLE EXPECTED_INVOICE type escape RATING_MAPPED update tablesample ``` 3. We type `O` (so the text in the editor is `PEO`) - An async call to `/autocomplete_suggestions?substring=PEO` gets made - Immediately, the current suggestions are filtered by the new search text (`PEO`), but we correctly filter out the unwanted entries too: ``` PEOPLE ``` 4. After a while the async results for the second call come in and replace the async results from the first call, they do not include `EXPECTED_INVOICE` so the results now correctly show ``` PEOPLE ``` ##### Video https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/feabd208-d63d-4870-9b9e-c1c230c142cf This means there is no flicker between the user typing and the async results coming in. This also means the results don't change as much so it reduces the impact of https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/48712. I don't think it completely removes all the cases where it happens, but it makes it more of an edge-case than it already is. #48712 still happens when in this scenario: 1. type `PEO` and wait for the results to come in 2. Remove the `O` and immediately use the arrow keys to select a suggestion 3. When the async call comes in the suggestion list (and your selection) is reset. Whether or not we want to wait with showing "sync" results is kind of unrelated. It might further reduce the impact of these edge-cases, but I don't think it will fully solve them either. Happy to include that in this PR though! Also happy to take another stab at solving these issues in a different way!', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 10, 30, 1, 6, 38, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}]

title: feat(sdk): support multiple interactive questions by decoupling from query builder reducer
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/44670 ### Description Supports using multiple interactive questions at a time by storing the states in React context, as opposed to relying on the query builder states. This PR replaces our use of query builder actions and selectors (e.g. `initQBRaw`, `updateQuestion`, etc.) with logic implemented in the SDK. ### How to verify - Go to the `test-multiple-instances-interactive-questions` branch in the demo app. - Go to `/dev`, the kitchen sink page. - You should be able to see multiple interactive questions and drill-down now. These interactive questions should be independent. ### Demo

Multiple Interactive Questions Demo - Watch Video
### Checklist - [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR
author: heypoom
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/Embedding', '')]

title: Do not insert newlines when typing text in the native editor.
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/40538

### Description

Works around a weird quirk in the ACE editor that causes newlines to be inserted when focus is called to quickly.

We were already using a timeout elsewhere, this approach just consolidates that.

The original issue was introduced when [upgrading to React 18](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/41975).

### How to verify

Describe the steps to verify that the changes are working as expected.

1. New question -> SQL Query
2. Start typing `SELECT`
3. Make sure the editor does not add spurious newlines

### Demo

https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/1250185/780ac0ba-101d-436b-8c4b-f0c2331409f6



### Checklist

I found no way to reproduce this issue in Cypress. I think the bug is innocent enough for it not to have e2e tests.

title: Fix Wrong Migration IDs for User Parameter Values Migration
body:
Per discussion in Slack, I made a mistake with the migration IDs as I wanted to backport to 50 but used 51 IDs. This PR uses 50 IDs and places the migrations in the correct place.

Not sure if it's mergable in this state because Stats has run with the PR containing the incorrect migration IDs.

The PR that added the incorrect migrations:
https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/45064

The backport PR which now has the correct migration IDs and (theoretically) is mergable into the 50 branch:
https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/45117
Since that backport PR should be ok, I've added 'no-backport' to this PR, since it's just an issue in Master, not the 50 branch.
author: adam-james-v

title: Allow unrestricted data perms to override block even if another table has legacy no-self-service
body:
Resolves https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/45116

This PR fixes block permission enforcement so that `unrestricted` data permissions for a table override block permissions, but `legacy-no-self-service` does not. Previously block permissions were being enforced all-or-nothing for a database. This means that a single table with `legacy-no-self-service` effectively makes the entire DB `legacy-no-self-service`, until the permission is updated to a normal value.

My solution is to additionally check the permissions for each individual table in the query, and skip enforcing block perms if any of them have `unrestricted` data perms.

Similar to https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/45045 this bug is an artifact of the fact that we added `legacy-no-self-service` towards the end of the project after the permission enforcement code had been migrated to the new APIs, and so we didn't detect all of the edge cases that resulted. (It's also a more niche case in the permissions migration.)
author: noahmoss
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/AdminWebapp', 'Admin and Webapp team')]

title: Fix combined cards crash when cards have invalid settings
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/45114

### Description

When a dashcard combines multiple cards and the cards have invalid `graph.metrics` settings we rendered an error instead of falling back to computing the default `graph.metrics`.

### How to verify & Demo

This loom shows that it works and describes how to reproduce it locally
https://www.loom.com/share/be81f926707c4c288a98ffc0d6e93879?sid=244e47b7-7fcf-4fa7-813f-c6feddb87c8a

- Create 2 compatible questions that use line/area/bar/combo charts
- Combine them on a dashcard
- Go to app db and put some invalid value into `graph.metrics` for both of them
- The dashcard should still work

### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR
author: alxnddr

title: Batch permission updates with many tables
body:
Addresses the likely root cause of a error reported by a customer: https://metaboat.slack.com/archives/C013N8XL286/p1720022143997779

Basically, for most permission updates, we just need to write a single row. However, if permissions are set at the DB-level (i.e. a single row for every table in the DB) and we change the permission of a single table, we need to delete the DB-level row and write a row for _every_ table to ensure consistency. 

Because we're writing these new table-level rows in a single `t2/insert!` call, it's generating a prepared statement with 6 parameters (one for each column in the `data_permissions` table) for every table. If the DB has more than 10,922 tables, this will hit Postgres's limit for parameters in a single prepared statement. The customer in question indicated they have fewer than this number of tables, but I can't see any other possible root cause of their error message.

Batching this into several updates gets around this limit. I've tested manually using a temp DB with many tables to ensure that the writes succeed. The permissions page itself is incredibly slow with this many tables but the DB writes don't seem to be the bottleneck. Not sure there's a great way to unit test this but open to suggestions.

If this is still an issue we can consider other more structural changes to reduce the number of permissions that needs to be written in this scenario.
author: noahmoss
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/AdminWebapp', 'Admin and Webapp team')]

title: Add tables pre-fetching to dashboard load
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/44830

### Description

This PR is the final part of solution to the https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/44830, ie. follow up for https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/45050. Analysis of the problem (stacktraces, sql query from linked issue) can be found in [this](https://www.notion.so/metabase/n-1s-while-loading-a-dashboard-7ec125c1d1e547dea132db6eceebdc2b?pvs=4) notion doc.

Briefly, main problem was preprocess being called on every card during dashboard hydration. Thanks to the linked PR metadata providers are now cached, so preprocess metadata is _db queried_ only once for cards with common database.

This PR reduces table db metadata queries. Previously query was executed for every card. This change reduces the amount to one call per database (which dashboard cards _may_ or may not share).

### How to verify

New test was added, counting number of `:metadata/table` toucan calls.

### Checklist

- [X] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR
author: lbrdnk
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge')]

title: ensure the canceled chan is closed
body:
Lots of ways to verify this.

#### Verifying with Siege

`siege` is a fantastic program. I'm testing by using a card against bigquery that selects 2000 rows. Grab an api key and then:

```
siege --concurrent=15 --time=30s --header="x-api-key:$API_KEY" "http://localhost:30500/api/card/108/query POST"
```

Hit it with 15 concurrent users for 30 seconds.

We will see some threads to watch for bigquery cancel chan, but they should go away

```clojure
;; on the fixed jar
user=> (count (into #{} (comp (map (fn [^Thread t] (.getName t)))
                        (filter #(str/includes? % "bigquery-cancel-watcher")))
              (.keySet (Thread/getAllStackTraces))))
30
user=> (count (into #{} (comp (map (fn [^Thread t] (.getName t)))
                        (filter #(str/includes? % "bigquery-cancel-watcher")))
              (.keySet (Thread/getAllStackTraces))))
0

;; on an unfixed jar these are acumulating
user=> (count (into #{} (comp (map (fn [^Thread t] (.getName t)))
                        (filter #(str/includes? % "bigquery-cancel-watcher")))
              (.keySet (Thread/getAllStackTraces))))
176
```

Note that i think we only leak now when there's an error in the streaming response, like

```
:cause Deflater has been closed, :_status 500}
java.lang.NullPointerException: Deflater has been closed
	at java.base/java.util.zip.Deflater.ensureOpen(Deflater.java:902)
	at java.base/java.util.zip.Deflater.deflate(Deflater.java:564)
	at java.base/java.util.zip.Deflater.deflate(Deflater.java:464)
	at java.base/java.util.zip.GZIPOutputStream.finish(GZIPOutputStream.java:163)
	at java.base/java.util.zip.DeflaterOutputStream.close(DeflaterOutputStream.java:244)
	at metabase.async.streaming_response$delay_output_stream$fn__52184.invoke(streaming_response.clj:120)
	at metabase.async.streaming_response.proxy$java.io.OutputStream$ff19274a.close(Unknown Source)
	at java.base/sun.nio.cs.StreamEncoder.implClose(StreamEncoder.java:439)
	at java.base/sun.nio.cs.StreamEncoder.lockedClose(StreamEncoder.java:237)
	at java.base/sun.nio.cs.StreamEncoder.close(StreamEncoder.java:222)
	at java.base/java.io.OutputStreamWriter.close(OutputStreamWriter.java:266)
	at java.base/java.io.BufferedWriter.implClose(BufferedWriter.java:398)
	at java.base/java.io.BufferedWriter.close(BufferedWriter.java:380)
	at metabase.async.streaming_response$write_error_BANG_.invokeStatic(streaming_response.clj:60)
	at metabase.async.streaming_response$write_error_BANG_.invoke(streaming_response.clj:45)
	at metabase.async.streaming_response$do_f_STAR_.invokeStatic(streaming_response.clj:77)
	at metabase.async.streaming_response$do_f_STAR_.invoke(streaming_response.clj:66)
	at metabase.async.streaming_response$do_f_async$task__52169.invoke(streaming_response.clj:87)
	at clojure.lang.AFn.run(AFn.java:22)
	at java.base/java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:572)
	at java.base/java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:317)
	at java.base/java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1144)
	at java.base/java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:642)
	at java.base/java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:1583)
2024-07-03 15:02:05,348 ERROR async.streaming-response :: bound-fn caught unexpected Exception
```

title: Optimize: compute chart title href only on mouseenter and focus
body:
Optimization of #43816 due to #43258

### Description

Previously: `getNewCardUrl` was being called to compute `href` for every dashcard title on mount and when dashboard parameters changed
Now: `getNewCardUrl` is called only when chart title gets hovered or focused. This means 0 calls during initial render, so app does not freeze anymore (arguably; at least not because of `href` anymore)


### How to verify

Follow steps from #43258 (it requires importing 6GB SQL file)

### Demo - simple case

The 1st part of the video shows hover, and the 2nd part shows focus (with Tab key).

https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/6830683/6317a1d0-b7c8-47f4-b443-4740a7e578ed

### Demo - performance case from issue report

#### Before

In the recording app is frozen for approx. 8s at 0:16 - 0:24

https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/6830683/b205228f-6d56-4dae-86fe-f718f3a80f77

#### After

In the recording app is "frozen" for approx. 1s at 0:16 - 0:17 - that's the initial render of 300 cards.

https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/6830683/cd47a485-80c5-4ae2-ba9f-974d8b87b766
author: kamilmielnik

title: Test data loading overhaul v3 [EXPERIMENTAL]
body:
This is the third time I'm attempting this project, previously attempted in #27860 and #27903 (see also previous Slack discussion [here](https://metaboat.slack.com/archives/CKZEMT1MJ/p1674245250025069)).

This is a complete rewrite of the test data loading code with a goal of making it easier to understand, easier to debug, easier for third-party driver authors to implement, and faster.

Instead of taking test dataset definitions which can be defined in like a dozen different ways (EDN files, calculated dynamically, etc.) and then creating appropriate `CREATE DATABASE`/`CREATE TABLE`/`INSERT INTO` statements on the fly with a million different driver multimethods and executing them, test data loading is now divided into two distinct stages:

1. Creating _artifacts_ that can be loaded later, including `.sql` script files and `.csv` files that can be loaded with [`COPY`](https://www.postgresql.org/docs/current/sql-copy.html). These are now **only** derived from EDN files
 
2. Loading the artifacts created in the previous stage into the database.

With two separate stages it's easy to inspect and debug the output and see what we will attempt to execute against the server in in the second stage, without needing to connect to the server at all. Contrast to the current code where SQL statements are generated and executed immediately making things hard to follow and debug.

`COPY` is significantly faster than `COPY` than `INSERT INTO`. About ~800ms vs 2 seconds for me with local Postgres, not really that much faster but IIRC from my previous attempts at this project it is several **minutes** faster for Cloud-based databases and Vertica/Oracle which are super slow despite being a database we run locally.

As part of this I think I also want to do what we did recently with [combining `test-data` and the `sample-dataset` together](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/35973) and just combine everything into one giant dataset. This will eliminate a lot of the complexity around switching between test datasets and faking support for multiple databases in Cloud-based DBs where we're limited to one DB and speed up CI by an order of magnitude. For datasets generated dynamically (the ones that use recent dates to test relative datetime code) I think we can add an extra step before step 1 and generate the relevant EDN files. That code should be much easier to follow since we'll have another intermediate artifact we can inspect.

So far this is only implemented for Postgres for the standard `test-data` dataset as a proof-of-concept. It is now using this new test data loading code to load `test-data` for Postgres, to verify it works. Next steps are to bring the other test datasets in as well and implement this for other drivers (which will require generalizing the Postgres implementation) and coming up with a sane deprecation plan for the old stuff. These next steps can be done in follow-on PRs.
author: camsaul
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/Querying', ''), ('.DX', 'Developer experience and QoL related.'), ('.Team/DevEx', '')]

title: Ignore unknown columns when reverting cards and dashboards
body:
When reverting cards and dashboards, ignores columns that are present in the revision but don't exist on the actual model. This should solve cases where a field is dropped between versions and makes a revision incompatible.

I've done this by first selecting the existing instance that we're reverting (via table name rather than toucan model) and getting the set of keys that are present. Then we simply ignore any fields that aren't part of that set.

I've also added a test case for this, and did some clean up of old toucan model references (i.e. `Card` -> `:model/Card`).

Note: this is _not_ a comprehensive fix for cross-version revisions. There only handles cases where columns are dropped, but other types of schema changes could also break revisions. So we still need to add better error handling for cases that aren't covered. 

Resolves https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/31901

I've filed https://github.com/metabase/metabasea/issues/45070 as a lower-priority follow-up to surface error messages better in revisions.
author: noahmoss
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/AdminWebapp', 'Admin and Webapp team')]

title: User Parameter Values Are Unique Per Dashboard
body:
Fixes: #43001
Fixes: #44858

User Parameter Values previously stored just the `parameter-id` and `user-id` as data to look up the last used parameter value. This isn't sufficient as the parameter id is not guaranteed to be unique, in particular this is true when a dashboard is duplicated: the parameters are copied to the new dashboard without changing the parameter id at all.

This means that we need to also store the dashboard-id in the user_parameter_value table and use that to update/get the last used value.

The migration removes existing entries to the user_parameter_value table because I want a non-nullable constraint on the dashboard_id column, and existing entries will not have a value. The only way to backfill those values would be to look through every dashboard containing parameters, and for every parameter check for a matching ID. 

Even if you can do this, there's no way to disambiguate if the same paramter exists on 2 dashboards anyway, so one of them might be wrong. I think it's not worth the trouble considering that removing the entries in this table doesn't break anything; it just becomes a mild inconvenience that a user has to select a filter value again (since the dashboard will use the default value). This was the behaviour of filters in the app until 50 anyway, so for those couple of times where the app's behaviour is regressed, it shouldn't be too shocking.
author: adam-james-v
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/DashViz', 'Dashboard and Viz team')]

title: [MBQL lib] Allow a space in datetime literal strings
body:
`Lib.diagnoseExpression` is stricter about this than the QP or FE
expression parser, making it reject expressions that tried to compare
datetimes to strings like `2024-07-02 14:34:17Z`.

Those used to work in 49.x, but a new `Lib.diagnoseExpression` call
while editing expressions caused it to regress.

Fixes #44916.

1. Run metabase: `yarn dev-ee`

title: Fix Menu button in admin app on mobile view
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/45042

### Description
The menu button in the mobile view of the admin app had 2 issues: It was the incorrect color, and clicking it didn't appear to do anything. Color was fixed by applying the a CSS module. The issue with the popover not displaying was due to how the `useEffect` added a listener to dismiss the list if something was clicked outside the component. Basically, the event was being fired during the same render, causing the value to be set then unset very quickly. This useEffect was replaced with the Mantine `useClickOutside` hook.

### How to verify

1. Go to the admin app with a mobile view
2. The menu button should be white, and the menu should appear when clicking on it.

### Demo
![chrome_5hWu5wAbNM](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/1328979/946662be-aa47-401b-a3a8-c54e9a8670a4)

title: [perf] Add caching on `dashboard_load_id`; reusable MetadataProviders
body:
**MetadataProvider cache**

The reusable MetadataProviders is a generally useful thing - within some
dynamic scope like an API request, a `clojure.core.cache` instance can
be provided as `lib.metadata.jvm/*metadata-provider-cache*`, and that
will be used to cache the provider for each `database-id`.

Reusing those providers can significantly reduce appdb traffic,
re-fetching the same metadata in different `MetadataProvider`
instances.

**Dashboard loads**

The FE can supply `?dashboard_load_id=uuid_string` on requests for a
dashboard load:

- `/api/dashboard/:id`
- `/api/dashboard/:id/query_metadata`
- `/api/dashboard/:id/dashcard/:dashcard_id/card/:card_id/query`

That provides a good cache key across that burst of N+2 API requests
that are part of a single load. Currently it is used for two things:

- Caching `get-dashboard` (used by the first two requests)
- Selecting the `clojure.core.cache` for `*metadata-provider-cache*`

Both use a TTL of 10 seconds, which is generally enough for the first
screenful of a dashboard load, if not the whole thing. (Browsers will
only issue a handful of requests at once, so a few long-running queries
might delay later parts of the dashboard from loading until after the
TTL expires.)
author: bshepherdson
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge')]

title: Fix `type/PK`  -> `type/Name` and `type/FK` field remapping in the QB
body:
Fixes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/45063
Fixes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/7231
Fixes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/37955

BE changes:
- Hydrates `name_field` for query metadata.

MBQL lib API changes:
- Fixes `dimensions` parsing. This makes `external`, i.e. `type/FK` remapping work out of the box. 
- Makes `type/PK` -> `type/Name` field remapping work.

FE changes:
- Makes `SearchValuePicker` handle mixed remapping options. Adds loading state.
- **Note that selected values are displayed as raw values and this is out of scope for this PR.**

How to verify type/PK -> type/Name remapping:
- Make sure that in Table Metadata for `People.Name` `Entity Name` semantic type is set
- Set `Filtering on this field` for `People.ID` to `A list of all values`
- Open `People` table. Click on `ID` -> Filter on this column. You should see a list of remapped values.
- Set `Filtering on this field` for `People.ID` to `Search box`
- Open `People` table. Click on `ID` -> Filter on this column.  Start typing some name. You should get autocomplete. Please note that the placeholder `Search by ID` is misleading and this is something that we need to fix separately.

How to verify type/FK -> column remapping:
- Open Table Metadata -> `Orders.Product ID` -> Click `Use original value` -> `Use foreign key` -> Select `Products.Title`.
- Set `Filtering on this field` to `A list of all values`
- Open `Orders` table. Click on `Product ID` -> Filter on this column. You should see a list of product names.
- Do the same with `Search box`.

title: Only check create-queries perms when fetching DB/schema metadata
body:
Resolves https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/45046

When checking read permissions for databases or schemas (the _metadata_, not the data itself), we previously had required `Data access` to be `Unrestricted` for at least one table.

In the new permissions system in v50, this is now dependent instead on the new `Create queries` permission. You can see a database or schema if you have _at least_ query builder access to any table.

However, we were still checking that the user also has `View data` access to the entire database (either unrestricted or sandboxed). Originally this was fine, since these were the only two options for `View data`, so this was just an extra check that caused no issues. When we added the transitional `No self-service (deprecated)` permission level, however, this resulted in unexpected behavior: if a user is in a group with `No self-service (deprecated)` set for any table, it causes the entire DB to fail the read check and be hidden from the browse data page.

I've fixed this by removing the unnecessary conditions in DB/schema permission checks, and added a couple new test cases.
author: noahmoss
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/AdminWebapp', 'Admin and Webapp team')]

title: Refactor issue tracing
body:
prep work for https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/44037 to try to make the diff reasonable in https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/44631

## Summary

- adds a local cache for issue fetching to make re-fetching issues not make API calls
- makes our closing keyword regex accept colons (eg. `fixed: #8675309`) 
- does issue-tracing using the issues API (because all PRs are also issues)
- adds helpers for finding the last released version

title: Remove incorrect default parameter from release note generation code
body:
By enabling release notes generation from either open or closed issues, I mis-set a defualt parameter in `getMilestonIssues()` - this removes that default and lets the (correct) default in `findMilestone()` prevail.

This did not affect the release-notes-preview job because it explicitly set its milestone status based on whether or not the version had been rleased already.

title: Fix - Invalid join clause does not disappear after changing query source to use a different database
body:
Closes #42385

### How to verify

1. Have another database connected
2. Start a question based on Orders table from Sample DB
3. Join Accounts table but do not specify join condition
4. Change data source to a table from a different DB

Right table should disappear from the join clause.
author: kamilmielnik
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/Querying', '')]

Otherwise the following scenario could cause issues -> Join -> Select table -> Select condition (here it's a complete join) -> Change the RHS table to a table without suggested join conditions to go back to `JoinDraft` with initial values -> Change DB", 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 7, 2, 14, 22, 4, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 2205389278, 'issue_id': 2385646321, 'author': 'kamilmielnik', 'body': "> @kamilmielnik in this case you need to either ignore initial values in `JoinDraft` or reset draft values in `Join` instead. Otherwise the following scenario could cause issues -> Join -> Select table -> Select condition (here it's a complete join) -> Change the RHS table to a table without suggested join conditions to go back to `JoinDraft` with initial values -> Change DB @ranquild This scenario works fine because in the last step the query actually has a join clause which will be removed when changing the database, so the draft will disappear. I'll add a test for it. edit: PR with additional test: #45083", 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 7, 3, 8, 18, 52, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}]

title: fix background on dashcard png export when in embed night theme
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/39546

### Description

This was in part extracted from [DRAFT- Embed pdf export - MS2 (+221 ‚àí55)](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/44463) where I fixed the background issues for the newly added dashboard export in embedding (therefore with night theme)

### How to verify

For dashcard:
- from embed preview of a dashboard
- set theme to night
- use dashcard actions to download results -> png
- it should have dark background


For single card:
- from embed preview of card
- set theme to night
- download results -> png
- it should have dark background
author: npretto
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/Embedding', '')]

title: Support compiling SQL with inlined parameters directly
body:
Fixes #34402
Fixes #32543 
Fixes #44915 
Resolves #28169 
Resolves #39331
Resolves #39336
Resolves #39339
Resolves #39353

In the 'view the SQL' modal we want to show people queries like 

```sql
SELECT * FROM birds WHERE type = 'cockatiel'
```

rather than

```sql
SELECT * FROM birds WHERE type = ?
```

Previously to make this work we generated the parameterized SQL first, then attempted to find all the `?` placeholders and replace them with inlined parameter values.

With the switch to Honey SQL 2 that we did in #28009 we can now use Honey SQL 2's `:inline` option to compile queries with inlined parameters directly, meaning we can get rid of the icky and buggy parse and splice logic entirely.
author: camsaul
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch')]

title: Batch processing usage metadata
body:
As discussed in https://metaboat.slack.com/archives/C0641E4PB9B/p1719478364644629

We want to bring back usage metadata that was introduced in https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/38229, namely:
- report_card.view_count, report_dashboard.view_count, metabase_table.view_count
- report_cast.last_used_at
- field_usage

This time we make it so that it consumes fewer resources by batch processing them using `grouper.`

We did realize that grouper does not provide consistency, and it's fine for these use cases since most of these data don't require high accuracy.

Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/44782, https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/44781

To disable this behavior, start MB with `MB_DISABLE_GROUPER_BATCH_PROCESSING=true`, this will force all submit task to be processed immediately.

## Comparision

Method: the number shows in the table below is from viewing the e-comerence dashboard from our example collection
And from the tool I added in https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/45176, I can count the number of db calls our application make to view this dashboard.

![Screenshot 2024-07-05 at 18 03 13](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/25661381/b93f1eca-7346-4114-9dff-c225aba8ab29)


| Branch                       | # db calls | total execution time (ms) |
|------------------------------|------------|----------------------|
| Master(aa110f2e)              | 800        | 1613                |
| master with all the tracking | 887        | 2261                |
| this branch                  | 821        | 1439                 |
author: qnkhuat
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/Workflows', 'aka BEC')]

title: do not reset metrics settings when dimension changes
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/42540

### Description

This PR prevents metrics visualization settings from resetting when chart dimension changes so that users can swap a dimension without the need to reconfigure metrics settings.

### How to verify

1. New Orders -> Count of Rows and Sum of Total by Created at
2. Go to viz settings and remove "Sum of Total" from Y-axis
3. Open the Summarize sidebar and change the dimension to Tax by clicking on it (not on the plus button)
4. Ensure the chart shows only "Count" series and "Sum of Total" is hidden

### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR
